verses.verse: Thanksgiving and Praise (Isa 25.1; 26.1; 40.1, 2) You will say on that day: “I will give thanks to you, O LORD, for though you were angry with me, your anger turned away, and you comforted me.

(Ex 15.2; Ps 118.14; Isa 26.3; 33.2) Surely God is my salvation; I will trust and will not be afraid, for the LORD (Q ms Heb mss Gk Syr Vg Tg: MT for Yah, the LORD) is my strength and my might; he has become my salvation.”
(Isa 41.18; Jn 4.10; 7.37, 38) With joy you will draw water from the wells of salvation.
And you will say on that day: “Give thanks to the LORD; call on his name; make known his deeds among the nations; proclaim that his name is exalted.
(Ex 15.1; Ps 98.1; Isa 24.14) Sing praises to the LORD, for he has done gloriously; let this be known in all the earth.
(Isa 49.26; Zeph 3.14) Shout aloud and sing for joy, O royal (Or O inhabitant of) Zion, for great in your midst is the Holy One of Israel.”
